# Draft:Ram Swaroop Potaliya

Dr. Ram Swaroop Potaliya (Village Katiyasni, Merta city, Nagour ,Rajasthan) is an Indian agricultural scientist, rural development reformer, and grassroots political leader from Rajasthan. He holds a Ph.D. in Agricultural Economics and is known for his work in renewable energy applications in agriculture, organic farming, water conservation, and sustainable rural development.
Early life and education
Potaliya earned his B.Sc. (Hons) in Agriculture from the University of Rajasthan, Jaipur followed by an M.Sc. in Agricultural Economics from Maharana Pratap University of Agriculture and Technology (MPUAT), Udaipur.
He completed his Ph.D. in Agricultural Economics with a thesis titled “Techno-Economics of Renewable Energy Sources in the Context of Rajasthan”, focusing on the financial viability and sustainability of renewable energy technologies in agriculture.
Academic and professional career
Potaliya has served as an Assistant Professor / Guest lecturer at the College of Dairy and Food Science Technology, MPUAT, where he taught subjects such as Project & Financial Management, Agricultural Marketing, and Rural Development Models.
He worked as a Senior Research Fellow on the Petroleum Conservation and Research Association’s PCRA New Delhi, project on improved cookstoves for rural areas, focusing on energy efficiency and environmental health.
His professional experience also includes roles as Project Expert, Economist, and District Project Coordinator for World Bank–supported rural development initiatives.
Political and social work
Potaliya began his political journey with the Akhil Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishad (ABVP), serving as District President in Kotputli, Jaipur (1996–2000), where he mobilized youth for value-based education and civic engagement. A permanent member of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) since 2000 and also involved in BARATIYA KISAN SANGH, he has contributed to booth-level planning, campaign strategies, and rural outreach in multiple constituencies.
He has been involved in BJP’s agricultural policy outreach, farmer training programs, and nationalistic campaigns promoting Swadeshi and rural self-reliance.
Development initiatives
Over two decades, Potaliya has led projects benefiting farmers, women, and youth in over 100 villages, including:
* Training more than 5,000 farmers in organic farming, micro-irrigation, vermiculture, and renewable energy use.
* Establishing demonstration farms in arid regions such as Nagour, Barmer, Jaisalmer, Jodhpur.
* Implementing solar drying and biogas units for rural women’s income generation.
Publications
Potaliya has authored and co-authored training manuals and articles on topics including environmental studies, renewable energy, drip irrigation, and compost-based energy solutions.
Affiliations
* Advisor, National Federation of Farmers Procurement, Processing & Retailing Cooperatives of India Ltd. (NACOF).
* Senior Advisor, Aravali Institute of Development Research.
* Chief Managing Director, Vedic Agriculture India Pvt. Ltd.
Honors and awards
* Academic Excellence Award – Government of Rajasthan (1994)
* Jindal Trust Scholarship (1995–1999)
* University Topper, [https://www.mpuat.ac.in/ Maharana Pratap Rajasthan University of Agriculture and Technology (1999)]
* Nominated by Maharana Mewar Foundation – University Topper (1999)
Personal life
Potaliya is based in Jodhpur, Rajasthan, and continues to work actively in agricultural policy, grassroots politics, and rural development.
